definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: The ban on intermarriage here is quite specific.
sentences.chinese: 很明確地規定了禁止通婚聯姻。

sentences.english: What do you think about mixed marriages?
sentences.chinese: 你對異族通婚是怎麼看的？

sentences.english: It was only in 1967 that the United States finally struck down its anti miscegenation laws.
sentences.chinese: 直到1967年，美國才廢除了反種族通婚的法律。

sentences.english: They were not forbidden to intermarry with the local people.
sentences.chinese: 他們未被禁止與當地人通婚。

sentences.english: In the Northern Dynasty, various nations were related through marriage frequently and the wedding custom are integrated with each other.
sentences.chinese: 北朝時期，各民族間的通婚頻繁，婚禮習俗彼此融合。

sentences.english: It was only in 1967 that the United States finally struck down1 its anti miscegenation laws.
sentences.chinese: 直到1967年，美國才廢除了反種族通婚的法律。

sentences.english: A Métis in Canada is the offspring of an Amerindian and a white person.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大的梅蒂斯人是指印第安人和白人通婚的後代。

sentences.english: No connubium between persons of the same stock; connubium between each division and some other.
sentences.chinese: 同根的人不能通婚，每一區同其他某區之間可以通婚。

sentences.english: No connubium between persons of the same stock; connubium between each division and some other.
sentences.chinese: 同根的人不能通婚，每一區同其他某區之間可以通婚。

sentences.english: Sorry to burst your bubble, but miscegenation does not "promote understanding between people."
sentences.chinese: 我認爲種族通婚並不能促進人們之間的相互理解。

sentences.english: At the time, interracial marriages were illegal in certain states.
sentences.chinese: 那時候，異族通婚在有些州屬於非法行爲。

sentences.english: Facts: A Virgina statute prohibits interracial marriages between whites and blacks.
sentences.chinese: 弗吉尼亞州某法禁止白人和黑人的種族間通婚。

sentences.english: Members of some ancient races intermarried with their own sisters.
sentences.chinese: 一些古代種族的成員與他們自己的姐妹們通婚。

sentences.english: However, in Deuteronomy , there were exceptions to this prohibition of intermarriage.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在《申命記》裏，也有關於允許通婚的特例。

sentences.english: Looking at trends in intermarriage is a complex matter.
sentences.chinese: 種族之間通婚趨勢是一個複雜的問題。

definition: cohabitation (of different populations or races)/to coexist
(of a woman) to marry a non-local or foreigner
